Title.evidence: Prophylactic Intraperitoneal Mesh Implantation in Abdominal Surgery: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This open-label randomised controlled trial was conducted at Bern University Hospital, Switzerland, from January 1, 2011, to February 29, 2014.

Participants.evidence: Participants with two or more risk factors (overweight/obesity, neoplastic disease, male sex, previous laparotomy) were included.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomised to receive either intraperitoneal mesh implantation or standard abdominal closure.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of incisional hernia at 3 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment by sealed envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 169 patients, 150 were analysed (69 mesh, 81 control).

Number_Analysed.evidence: Of 169 patients, 150 were analysed (69 mesh, 81 control).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The cumulative incidence of incisional hernia was significantly lower in the mesh group (7.2% vs 18.5%, P = .03).

Harms.evidence: Abdominal pain was more frequent in the mesh group at 6 weeks (65% vs 44%, P = .04) but not at 12 and 36 months.
